meanings.definition: a concluding section of a literary work
meanings.sent1: The epilogues in the story wrapped up all loose ends.
meanings.sent2: The author included epilogues to give closure to the readers.
meanings.sent3: The epilogues were like the cherry on top of the story.
meanings.sent4: The epilogues served as the final bow on the tale.
meanings.sent5: The epilogues left a lasting impression on the readers.

meanings.definition: a speech or piece of writing at the end of a play or book
meanings.sent1: The actor delivered the epilogues with emotion.
meanings.sent2: The epilogues summarized the main themes of the play.
meanings.sent3: The epilogues brought a smile to the audience's faces.
meanings.sent4: The epilogues echoed in the minds of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The epilogues captivated the attention of the readers.

meanings.definition: a short section at the end of a film or television show that provides additional information or a conclusion
meanings.sent1: The epilogues revealed the fate of the characters.
meanings.sent2: Viewers eagerly awaited the epilogues after the movie.
meanings.sent3: The epilogues added a touch of humor to the ending.
meanings.sent4: The epilogues were the final puzzle pieces of the show.
meanings.sent5: The epilogues left a lasting impact on the audience.
